snippet: A follow-up after 10 years of men and women who reported using aspirin and other nonsteroidal pain relievers found a 37 percent reduced risk of liver cancer.
abstract: A follow-up after 10 years of men and women who reported using aspirin and other nonsteroidal pain relievers found a 37 percent reduced risk of liver cancer.

headline.main: Aspirin Tied to Reduced Risk of Liver Cancer
headline.print_headline: Patterns: Aspirin Tied to Reduced Risk of Liver Cancer
